dt: {bc}to pass quickly or abruptly from one place or condition to another
{bc}to move in an erratic fluttering manner

et: Middle English {it}flitten{/it}, of Scandinavian origin; akin to Old Norse {it}flytjask{/it} to move, Old English {it}flēotan{/it} to float
shortdef: to pass quickly or abruptly from one place or condition to another
to move in an erratic fluttering manner
